sentences.english: The farmer built an electric fence around his field to put an end to trespassing .
sentences.chinese: 那農民在他的田地四周築起一道電網，以防閒人侵入。

sentences.english: A sign on the office door said"Off limits to all unauthorized personnel".
sentences.chinese: 辦公室門上貼有標誌“閒人免進”。

sentences.english: William: I have no time to record history. Let those free people do that.
sentences.chinese: 我沒時間記錄歷史，讓那些閒人去做吧。

sentences.english: Obviously like something happened and she scratched you.
sentences.chinese: 很閒人就像有些事發生了，她撓了你。

sentences.english: Can reserve a loiterer as well.
There were only the passersby on the side watching the excitement and making comments.
sentences.chinese: 只有一幫閒人幫旁邊看熱鬧指點江山。

sentences.english: We entered through a door marked "Private".
sentences.chinese: 我們穿過一扇寫着“閒人免進”的門。

sentences.english: Source of water, no entry without permission.
Sensitive paper data should be kept in a locked, limited-access area.
sentences.chinese: 敏感的文件數據要鎖起來，閒人免進。

sentences.english: Love is the business of the idle and the idleness of the busy.
sentences.chinese: 愛情是閒人的正經事，忙人的偷閒玩意。

definition: to relieve boredom or melancholy/a diversion
variant of 閒人|闲人[xian2 ren2]/idle person/idler/unconcerned person
to fast or abstain from meat, wine etc/vegetarian diet/study room/building/to give alms (to a monk)
to waste (one's breath, one's energy etc)/to try in vain
pavilion with a view/high/tall/high fronted, curtained carriage (old)
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
romance/beautiful scenery/small or petty (of talk etc)
to examine/to check/to keep a lookout/cautious/restrained (in speech or mannerisms)
dawn/daybreak/to know/to let sb know/to make explicit
